summary: TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2001 DAEWOO LANOS. WHILE DRIVING AT AN UNKNOWN SPEED, SMOKE EMITTED UNDER THE HOOD OF THE VEHICLE. THE CONTACT DISCOVERED THAT THE CAMSHAFT SENSOR AND WIRES WERE BURNED AND MELTED. THE CONTACT SUSTAINED A BURNED HAND THAT DID NOT REQUIRE MEDICAL ATTENTION. A POLICE REPORT WAS NOT FILED. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT DIAGNOSED OR REPAIRED. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 117,000.

THERE ARE TWO RECALL ON THE DAEWOO LANOS'S CAM POSITION SENSOR. I'M GETTING ENGINE CHECK LIGHTS WITH A FAULT CODE CALLING OUT THE CAM POSITION SENSOR. MY MECHANIC SAYS I SHOULD TAKE IT INTO A DEALER TO HAVE THE RECALL DONE. MY DEALER SAYS THE SENSOR DOES NOT FALL IN THE RIGHT DATE CODE OR MANUFACTURER OF SAID SENSOR.   IT COST ME 100 DOLLARS TO "CHECK" FOR THE RECALL WHICH I FIND OUT I DON'T NEED. BUT MY ENGINE CHECK LIGHT IS STILL COMING ON. THE DEALER SAYS MY SENSOR DOESN'T WORK AND WILL HAVE TO REPLACE IT ANY WAY. WHICH I HAVE TO PAY FOR THE PART AND NOW LABOR WHEN IT COMES IN. SO, BECAUSE OF A RECALL WHICH I DON'T NEED, I'VE PAID 100 FOR INVESTIGATION, 114 FOR PART AND NEXT IS LABOR FOR THE PART TO BE INSTALLED. I FEEL LIKE A SHEERED SHEEP. THEN I FIND OUT THAT THE DEALER GETS 55 DOLLARS FROM DAEWOO FOR CHECKING THE RECALL ALSO.  *TR

CONSUMER REPLACED DEAD BATTERY IN 2001 DAEWOO LANOS.  WHEN CONSUMER STARTED THE VEHICLE SMOKE CAME FROM UNDER THE HOOD. *KB  THE CONSUMER BELIEVES THE SMOKE MAY HAVE BEEN A RESULT OF THE RECALLED CAMSHAFT POSITION SENSOR.  THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER WHERE IT STILL SITS TO DATE.  THE CONSUMER REQUESTED REIMBURSEMENT OF THE PURCHASE PRICE.   *NM

CONSUMER RECEIVED  RECALL 02V131001  FOR AIR BAGS, AND TO DATE HAS NOT BEEN ABLE TO FIND A DEALER IN THE AREA TO DO THE REPAIRS. *AK  FRONT SAFETY BELT WAS DEFECTIVE.  THE BELT WOULD NOT EXTEND AND RETRACT PROPERLY WHICH SOMETIMES RESULTED IN A VERY TIGHT AND  UNCOMFORTABLE FIT.  *BF  *NM

RECALL CAMPAIGN  ISSUED FOR CAMSHAFT POSITION SENSOR IN DAEWOO LANOS 2001.  *BF  WHEN THE CONSUMER STARTED THE VEHICLE IT'S CHECK ENGINE LIGHT ILLUMINATED.  THE VEHICLE WAS THEN DRIVE ONLY 100 FEET WHEN IT SUDDENLY SHUT DOWN.  THE CONSUMER WAS NOT ABLE TO RESTART THE VEHICLE.  THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER. THE DEALER REPLACED THE CMP BUT LATER DETERMINED THAT WHEN THE CMP WENT OUT THE VEHICLE RAN LONG ENOUGH TO CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE ENGINE'S VALVES.
CONSUMER RECEIVED RECALL NOTICE 04V357000  CONCERNING  CAM SHAFT POSITION SENSOR.  DEALER WAS NOT IN OPERATION.  SERVICE MANGER MICHELLE.  *AK
NHTSA  RECALL 04V357000 CONCERNING CAM SHAFT POSITION SENSOR.   DEALER REFUSED TO HONOR THE RECALL BECAUSE THE CAM SHAFT WAS NOT DEFECTIVE.  *AK

CONSUMER RECEIVED NHTSA RECALL 04V357000 REGARDING THE CRANK SHAFT POSITION SENSOR. COMPANY WAS OUT OF BUSINESS. NO DEALERSHIP WAS AVAILABLE.  CONSUMER INDICATED  THERE WAS ONLY ONE DAEWOOD DEALERSHIP IN TOWN AND THEY REFUSED TO PROVIDE HELP.   *AK   *NM
CONSUMER RECEIVED TWO RECALL NOTICES 02V131002 CONCERNING  AIR BAGS, AND 02V257001 REGARDING BRAKES HOSE. DEALER WAS NOT IN OPERATION.*AK
CONSUMER TOOK  VEHICLE IN FOR SERVICING CONCERNING   CAM SHAFT  SENSOR RECALL. AFTER THE WORK WAS DONE THE SERVICE ENGINE LIGHT STILL CAME ON, AND CONSUMER  WAS VERY DISSATISFIED. *AK

RECALL 04V357000 FOR THE CAM SHAFT POSITION SENSOR WAS ISSUED.  CONSUMER WAS UNABLE TO REACH THE MANUFACTURER FOR THREE WEEKS. *AK  THE CONSUMER IS HAVING A PROBLEM FINDING A SERVICE DEALER TO SERVICE RECALL ISSUE.  *TC

04 V 357 000/CAMSHAFT POSITION SENSOR/MIL: CONSUMER HAS A CONCERN THAT THEY ARE UNABLE TO LOCATE AN AUTHORIZED SERVICE CENTER WITHIN THEIR STATE. THEIR VEHICLE IS EXPERIENCING THE SYMPTOM AS DESCRIBE IN THE RECALL NOTICE. CONSUMER DOES NOT WANT TO TAKE A CHANCE OF DRIVING THE VEHICLE OUTSIDE THE AREA BECAUSE THE DEALER OR THE MANUFACTURER WILL NOT TAKE ON THE RESPONSIBILITY OF A POSSIBLE FIRE OCCURRING WHILE IN ROUTE.  *JB   *SC
RECALL 04V357000 CONCERNING CAM SHAFT POSITION SENSOR. CONSUMER IS UNABLE TO FIND A DAEWOO REPAIR SHOP NOR CONTACT THE NUMBER PROVIDED ON THE DAEWOO RECALL LETTER FOR SERVICE. *AK *TC
THE CONSUMER RECEIVED RECALL 02V131000 IN REFERENCE TO THE AIR BAGS.  THERE WERE NO DEALERS TO MAKE THE REPAIRS AT NO COST TO CONSUMER.  *AK   *SC
THE CONSUMER RECEIVED A RECALL NOTICE(02V257001) REGARDING THE BRAKE HOSE.  THERE WERE NO DEALERS IN THE AREA TO PERFORM THE RECALL. *JB
CONSUMER RECEIVED A RECALL NOTICE(02V257001) REGARDING THE BRAKE HOSE. THERE WAS NO DEALER AVAILABLE TO PERFORM THE RECALL. *JB

CONSUMER RECEIVED RECALL 02V257001 CONCERNING  BRAKE HOSE. DEALER WAS NOT IN OPERATION.*AK

RE:RECALL ON  DAEWOO 02V-131 ; BOTH PASSENGER AIR BAG ASSEMBLY MODIFICATION AND CAMSHAFT POSITION SENSOR.   *BF  WHEN THE CONSUMER TOLD THE DEALER HE WAS BRINGING THE VEHICLE IN TO HAVE THE RECALL ON THE CAMSHAFT POSITION SENSOR AND AIR REPAIRED, HE WAS TOLD THERE WAS A 5 PAGE WAITING LIST AND NO PARTS WERE AVAILABLE. *JB

DAEWOO AND THE PROBLEM OF COMMUNICATION TO DAEWOO MOTOR AMERICA.   *BF  THE CONSUMER WAS UNABLE TO TALK TO ANYONE REGARDING THE AIR BAG RECALL.  (RECALL 02V131001). *JB

SAFETY RECALL ON DAEWOO LANOS PASSENGER SIDE AIR BAG.  *BF  THE CONSUMER RECEIVED A RECALL LETTER AFTER HER DAUGHTER HAD ALREADY BEEN INVOLVED IN AN ACCIDENT.  THE VEHICLE WAS REAR ENDED AND PUSHED INTO ANOTHER VEHICLE AND SUBSEQUENTLY THE AIR BAGS DID NOT DEPLOY.  THE DRIVERS SIDE SEAT BROKE AS WELL. (RECALL 02V131001).  *JB
THE CONSUMER WAS CONCERNED THAT DRIVING THE VEHICLE SOME 75 MILES TO A DEALER FOR THE AIR BAG REPAIR AND OUT OF POCKET EXPENSE FOR THE NHTSA RECALL  02V131000.  *JB

02 V 131 001/FMVSS 201 AIR BAG DEPLOYMENT & 04 V 357 000/CAMSHAFT POSITION SENSOR/MIL: CONSUMER WAS UNABLE TO GET THESE RECALLS HONOR, BECAUSE -NO AUTHORIZED SERVICE CENTERS WERE AVAILABLE IN THEIR AREA.   *JB

THE CAM SHAFT POSITION SENSOR  FAILED. AS A RESULT,  ENGINE SENSOR LIGHT STAYED ON.  RECALL 04V357000 WAS ISSUED, HOWEVER  DEALER STATED THE ENGINE SERIAL NUMBER WAS NOT INCLUDED. *AK  THE VEHICLE CHECK ENGINE LIGHT COMES ON AND THE DEALER ADVISED THAT ENGINE NUMBER WAS NO LISTED IN THE RECALL LIST.  CONSUMER REQUESTS THAT THE RECALL LIST BE UPDATED BECAUSE HE TALKED TO SEVERAL CONSUMERS WITH THE SAME PROBLEM.   *TC

THE VEHICLE'S CAM SHAFT POSITIONING SENSOR FAILED.  *NM  THIS FAULTY SENSOR CAUSED THE VEHICLE TO STALL WHILE DRIVING.  ALTHOUGH THE SENSOR WAS REPLACED THE VEHICLE CONTINUED TO STALL.  THE TECHNICIAN INDICATED THAT WHEN THE CMP FAILED THE VEHICLE MUST HAVE RUN LONG ENOUGH TO CAUSE THE VALVES TO MESS UP.  THE TECH INDICATED THAT HE WOULD HAVE TO PULL THE ENGINE AND HAVE THE VALVES REGROUND.  *NM

ONE DEALER INDICATED THAT THE VEHICLE HAD TO BE SERVICED THERE OR YOU GO TO THE BOTTOM OF THE LIST. THE OTHER DEALER WON'T MAKE A LIST.  PROJECTED REPAIRS ARE ESTIMATED AT TWO YEARS.  *NM

PURCHASED VEHICLE NEW. IDLE SPEED CHANGES AT WILL, SO FAST I WAS GOING 45 MPH IN 2ND GEAR. BEEN TO DEALER 5 TIMES. STILL NOT RESOLVED. DON'T KNOW HOW TO FIX IT. DEALER ONE TIME INSTALLED A LONGER WIRING HARNESS, TO NO AVAIL. CAR JUST SITTING AND ENGINE SPEED WILL RAISE AT DROP WITHOUT ME TOUCHING ANYTHING.*AK

I CANNOT FIND ANY DEALER/SERVICE AREA TO REPAIR ANY RECALLED  PROBLEMS.  AT 18,700 MILES THE CARS STEERING IS STARTING TO MAKE CLUNKING SOUND WHEN STEERING IS TURNED WHEN CAR IS NOT IN MOTION. CLUNKING IS FELT AT THE BRAKE PEDAL.    *NM

WHILE DRIVING THE VEHICLE AT 45 MPH, THE DRIVER LOST CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE WHICH RESULTED IN THE VEHICLE CRASHING INTO AN EMBANKMENT. THE CONSUMER STATED THAT NEITHER OF THE FRONTAL AIR BAGS DEPLOYED UPON IMPACT. THE DRIVER SUSTAINED MINOR INJURIES.   *NM

summary: 2001 DAEWOO, LANOS;  ENGINE STALLING, HEAD LIGHTS AND INTERIOR LIGHT NONFUNCTIONAL, SIGNAL LIGHTS/HAZARD (EMERGENCY) LIGHTS NONFUNCTIONAL.  I RECEIVED A LETTER FROM THE DAEWOO COMPANY APOLOGIZING FOR THERE BANKRUPTCY IN MAY 2002.  THEY PROVIDE A TELEPHONE NUMBER FOR CUSTOMERS WITH SERVICING ISSUES HOWEVER THESE TELEPHONE NUMBERS ARE BUSY, AN ANSWERING MACHINE PICKS UP OR THEY ARE NONFUNCTIONAL.  THEY ALSO PROVIDE A WEBSITE FOR SERVICE LOCATORS.  I HAVE NOT FOUND ANYONE WILLING TO  SERVICE MY CAR DUE TO UNAVAILABILITY OF PARTS.  *LA
TIMING BELT FAILS, CAUSING THE VEHICLE TO SHUT OFF IN TRAFFIC.  DEALER STATES THERE IS A NATIONWIDE SHORT ON THE PART.*AK
CONSUMER NOTICED WHEN DEPRESSING GAS PEDAL AT SAME TIME BRAKE PEDAL WAS BEING DEPRESSED . MANUFACTURER AND DEALER HAD BEEN CONTACTED. *AK

WHILE DRIVING THE AXLE BROKE.   *NLM   THE CONSUMER HIT A CURB, AND AFTER GETTING THE VEHICLE BACK FROM REPAIR, THE AXLE BROKE AGAIN.  ANOTHER SERVICE DEALER FOUND THE AXLE NEEDED MORE REPAIR AND ALSO FOUND THE WRONG PARTS WERE USED.   *SCC    *JB
THIS IS A BAD COMPLAINT THAT NEEDS TO BE FIXED. IT NEEDS A REAL DESCRIPTION. PLEASE PROVIDE MORE INFORMATION .TS
